I've tried to follow t=
his thread as best I can, but I don't see the
coupling.  I thought the @typ=
e was simply a hint from the server to
the client about what representation=
 is available at the other end.
The server could have:
<a rel=3Dnext type=
=3Dtext/html href=3D"...">Search Me</a>
<a rel=3Dnext type=3Dapplication/at=
om+xml href=3D"...">Search Me</a>

In this case, @type is simply used as li=
nk selection criteria in
concert with @rel.  The URI may or may not be exac=
tly the same.  I
don't see the coupling.  In the end, there are a finite nu=
mber of
representations available for a resource and a finite number of
rep=
resentations understood by the client, and this just seems like a
helpful w=
ay for the server to help the client in negotiating the most

ut then again... I may have missed some essential info
